text:
Use the **Control Panel > Settings** for how things appear and behave by default such as icons, text, links etc.
ideal for buttons is "icons + text"
title: Appearance of default wiki items

text: Go to Sidebar > Control Panel > Plugins > Menu Bar Plugins >> Read the info here
title: Create a menu

text:
Create a new toddler named Menu palette or some such thing . 

Transclude all the core UI button codes you need.

Include the menu bar essential tag to include it in the top menu. 

Create a new Tiddler named Buttons (or anything)
tag: $:/tags/MenuBar
caption: Buttons
target: the 'Menu Palette' tiddler name

Once click to open all the buttons you need.
title: Create a menu palette on the menu bar

text:
For instance to add a button to save wiki:

Find  $:/core/ui/Buttons/save-wiki and add the tag  $:/tags/TopRightBar (!Dangerous for future upgrades)
**Safe:**
It may be better to make a new tiddler with whatever name you want and tag that tiddler with $:/tags/TopRightBar and then put {{$:/core/ui/Buttons/save-wiki}} in the text field. That will help prevent any problems during future upgrades. Using $:/tags/TopLeftBar will put it in the top left instead of the top right.

You can also do similarly for other core ui items found in control panel > plugins > core >>

title: How to add something to the TopRightBar

text:
1. for nested ToC for a top level item say X, create a new item titled X (empty or with contents) > Include the tag exactly: "TableOfContents"; 
2. then tag any other Tiddler with a tag name X and that item will be nested in the ToC
title: How to create a Table of Contents
